Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the New York Times admitted that the anonymous op-ed was not written by a Trump administration official.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a website that trolls conservatives and does not provide any credible evidence or sources.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the op-ed was fake and that the New York Times admitted to being trolled without any factual basis.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the op-ed was written by a genuine senior official in the Trump administration, as claimed by the New York Times.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the New York Times described the author of the op-ed as a senior official in the Trump administration.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times in the provided information.
